projects.name: iWin
projects.description:
iWin is a simple solution that we can use to transfer files, links, or text from iOS devices to Windows PCs. It uses the mDNS protocol for broadcasting service and a RESTful API for receiving files.

If you want to give it a try, let's do that by following the instructions in this documentation.

Created with Go and Swift.

projects.name: Tasky
projects.description:
Tasky brings the traditional desk board into your computer. This allow you to take notes, list todo-tasks, and stay focused whenever you want, quickly and easily.

For the demo, you can check it out at taskyboard.online, or if you want to see the code, you can find it on GitHub.

Created with React.

projects.name: Picterest
projects.description:
Picterest is a web-based Pinterest clone that allows you to discover, created, and save images.

This project was a part of CSS326 Database Programming Laboratory course where I developed it with my peer as a full-stack developer. I learned so many fundamental topics here including Frontend Development (VueJS, Tailwind CSS), Backend Development (PHP), Database Development (MySQL), REST API, and much more.

This is not implemented online, but you can explore its codebase on GitHub.

Created with VueJS, PHP, and MySQL.

projects.name: Catch the fruits
projects.description:
Catch the fruits is a mini Java game where players need to catch falling fruits. This game applies Java AWT and Object-Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts.

It was a part of ITS103 Object-Oriented Programming Laboratory course. During this course, I learned and implemented OOP concepts such as abstraction, encapsulation, inheritance and polymorphism in Java.

This is not implemented online, but you can explore its codebase on GitHub or take a quick look at this presentation.

Created with Java.
